name: Goblins
background:
Goblins are small creatures who dwell in the dark corners of Tyria, making homes where big folk don’t care to go. They rely on numbers and trickery to defeat more powerful opponents. 

These little creatures have long sought to carve out a place amongst the people of Tyria, only to be either ignored or treated as pests by the other species. The Havoc Wars forced the tribes to unite, and briefly saw them treated with respect by the Grand Alliance, but this respect quickly faded and now the Goblins once more struggle to find their place amongst the big folk.
backgroundFull:
Goblins are one of the most widespread and adaptable species in Tyria, who refer to most other species in Tyria as “big folk”, tending to look at them warily. Many big folk tend to view Goblins as thieves and pests, hunting them on sight. Goblins avoid them, except to take what the big folk leave behind and to protect their homes. There are exceptions to this rule, as a Goblin’s friendship is won easily with a little respect, or even just food. 

While the tribes and nations of big folk claimed valuable lands and built nations throughout Tyria, the minute Goblins were pushed into whatever places remained. Goblins have adapted to live in these remote locations, like forests, caves and other hidden places. This has given rise to many Goblin clans with radically different cultures, outlooks, and even gods, all influenced by their homelands. These clans vary greatly, from the forest dwelling Spider Clan who allied with the beasts of their native forest, to the plains dwelling Wolf Clan, and the eccentric Bat Clan who made their homes throughout the caves and mountains of Tyria. For most of their history, the Goblins held loyalty only to their own clan and cared little for the others.

The Goblin clans were forced to come out of the shadows, however, when the Havoc Wars began. The Havoc Gods began to destroy caves and forests and rampage through the open plains, forcing many Goblins to flee. Many different clan leaders met together and agreed to unite against this common enemy. The Goblins sent envoys to the Empire and Elves, applying to join the Grand Alliance, but were initially ignored. Yet, as Grand Alliance armies were slowly being driven back, the Goblins were winning small victories and launching raids from behind enemy lines. Goblin troops proved their worth in the war, working as expert scouts, ambushers, and raiders. For a short time, Goblins were treated almost as equals by the big folk of Tyria. 

The Goblin Clans soon lost their hard earned respect though, as once the Havoc Wars ended and the danger passed, few Humans or Elves were interested in the Goblins or their concerns. The Goblins were simply expected to return to their forgotten corners of Tyria, and they were once again treated as pests and thieves when they tried to take anything more. The Goblins, however, remained united even as they returned to their different homes, with clan leaders continuing to meet in order to exchange aid and trade goods. 

How will you bring respect to your clan?

spells.name: Spider Might
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Mischievous Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Stinging Spider
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 3 hits with Bane.

spells.name: Bat Thirst
spells.effect: Pick up to four enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Piercing Assault against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Pouncing Wolf
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with AP(2) each.

spells.name: Wolf Resiliance
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get +1 to defense rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getUnitBaseCostDiff({ quality: 4, defense: 5, tough: 2, rules: ["Tough"] }, { defense: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Biting Bat
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 6", which take 1 hit with AP(2) and Skewer each.

specialRules.name: Mischievous
specialRules.description: When attacking, targets must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6 when blocking hits from this model's weapons.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Traversal
specialRules.description: May move through friendly and enemy units.

specialRules.name: Instinctive
specialRules.description: When this model is activated, if it is able to shoot/charge an enemy unit, then it must immediately attack the closest valid target and gets +1 to hit rolls for that attack.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Crossing Barrage
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Thrust in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Thrust in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Quick Shot. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Rapid Charge Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game moves +4" when using Charge actions. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Evasion. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Shred in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Shred in melee.

specialRules.name: Skewer
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets Deadly(+3).

specialRules.name: Precision Fighter Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 friendly units within 12", which gets +1 to hit rolls in melee once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Surprise Attack
specialRules.description: Counts as having Infiltrate. Once deployed via this rule, roll X dice, for each 4+ one enemy unit within 3” takes 2 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Good Fighter
specialRules.description: This model gets +1 to hit rolls in melee.

specialRules.name: Caster Group
specialRules.description: This model counts as having Caster(1).

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Piercing Assault against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Thrust
specialRules.description: When charging, gets +1 to hit rolls and AP(+1) in melee.

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but can’t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spell’s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18” in line of sight of the caster’s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Mischievous Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Mischievous, enemies taking hits from it must re-roll successful unmodified defense results of 5-6 from Mischievous (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.
